clinical_study.brief_title: Mobile Sensing and Support for Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Monocentric Study for Development of a Smartphone Application for Patients With Depressive

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is two fold, first to explore the potential of context sensitive intervention delivery to provide in-situ support for people with depressive symptoms, second to explore the detection of daily-life behavior based on smart phone sensor information to identify subjects with a clinically meaningful depression level.

detailed_description.textblock: To conduct a very first pilot trial, a monocentric, single-arm clinical study is conducted. The study is approved by the local ethics committee of the Canton of Zurich in Switzerland and the Swiss Agency for Therapeutic Products. It is conducted in full accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki, with all subjects providing their electronic informed consent prior to participation. As the main interest lies in a proof of concept of the proposed MOSS app, emphasis is put on real life conditions. A range of different recruitment channels is used to attract subjects from the general public; they include physical flyers, online posts on relevant online bulletin boards and the Google Play Store.

primary_outcome.description: subjective depressive symptoms to compare the detected symptoms measured by the app This outcome is needed for the sensing part of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (ZUF-8)- measures client satisfaction with the app
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at post (at least 6 weeks after baseline) however some participants will use the app longer than 6 weeks, maximum 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Client satisfaction with the app is assessed

other_outcome.measure: Patient Health Questionnaire - for depression (PHQ-9) change
other_outcome.time_frame: baseline and every other week for at least 6 weeks up to 6 months
other_outcome.description: Change of symptoms due to the Support app. As the study is two-fold and also includes a supporting part, this measure is needed for the supporting part of the study

arm_group.description: This phase of the study is designed to develop the app. due to algorithms the app should lern to detect depressive symptoms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- self-declaration of depressive symptoms
- app runs on Android 4.0 and higher
- germen speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- psychotic symptoms
- bipolar symptoms
- drug or alcohol dependency
- dementia
